title: Inter Milan begin talks with Barcelona for Ivan Rakitic
text:
Inter Milan have held talks with Barcelona over the possible transfer of midfielder Ivan Rakitic.

The Croatia international has been constantly linked with a departure from the Nou Camp after falling down the pecking order under Ernesto Valverde and the Spanish giants are reluctant to extend his current contract.

He has been linked with a host Europe's top clubs but failed to secure a move away in the summer. Inter are favourites to land him in January with Antonio Conte keen on bringing him to San Siro.

Inter Milan have held talks with Barcelona of the possible transfer of midfielder Ivan Rakitic

According to Spanish outlet Sport, Inter and Barcelona are already locked in negotiations. The two clubs met last week and although talks didn't progress much they are confident of agreeing a deal.

Barcelona believe Rakitic is worth €35million (£30m) but are wary that his value will drop when he enters the final year of his contract next summer.

Rakitic has started just one of 12 matches for Barcelona across all competitions this season.

Barcelona signed Brazilian midfielder Arthur Melo in 2018 and the arrival of Frenkie de Jong from Ajax this summer has pushed Rakitic even further down the pecking order.

Carles Alena and Riqui Puig are also expected to make the step up from La Masia to the first team soon, while Sergi Roberto can play in central midfield if needed to.
